body:
They banned @jasonkahnler, @DGKSK8LIFE, @Civil, and at least one other user I forget for personal reasons. Basically, the admins were salty about an argument they'd had with each one of them and made up completely ridiculous excuses to permanently ban them from both the site and discord.

And my point about discord was, they use "discord doesn't have free speech" as an excuse to also ban things that are *not* against discord's rules, just because they don't personally like it.
body_html:
They banned @jasonkahnler, @DGKSK8LIFE, @Civil, and at least one other user I forget for personal reasons. Basically, the admins were salty about an argument they'd had with each one of them and made up completely ridiculous excuses to permanently ban them from both the site and discord.

And my point about discord was, they use "discord doesn't have free speech" as an excuse to also ban things that are not against discord's rules, just because they don't personally like it.

body:
He acted stupid in the discord and got banned for it. However, the admins had a lot of arguments with him in the past and hated him, and they wanted to ban him from the site too. So they removed him from the ruqqus dev team, then immediately permabanned him from the entire site for "impersonation" because his bio said he was on the dev team (because he *was* until that second).

Also how did you break ruqqus (that means finding bugs, right)? Yet another thing literally everyone but me has done (not that it's)!

Also how did you break ruqqus (that means finding bugs, right)? Yet another thing literally everyone but me has done (not that it's)!

body:
>So they removed him from the ruqqus dev team, then immediately permabanned him from the entire site for "impersonation" because his bio said he was on the dev team (because he was until that second).

Ah, that sounds like some really sketchy behavior from the admins. The [/help/admins](https://ruqqus.com/help/admins) page doesn't seem to list him. I'll check the discord later for more info.

>Also how did you break ruqqus (that means finding bugs, right)? Yet another thing literally everyone but me has done (not that it's)!

Nah, not "everyone" has it. (Perhaps when you find a bug, ask the admins for it? I don't know lol. kek said this a few months ago on the discord: "Breaker of Ruqqus is earned when you find a bug that causes Ruqqus to crash", while someone else said that the admins sometimes award it for really trivial things. It seems that Seq37 is quite obsessed with trying to breaking ruqqus, so maybe you can ask him about it.)

[I recently found out from this post that some badges are clickable](https://ruqqus.com/post/3un4/10-badges-an-absolute-record). So my badge links to here: https://ruqqus.com/post/gg9/500-internal-server-error

I was really vague in my original post, but I found out that when you searched for posts, private ones were still visible, but only when you were logged in (I ended up voting on some of them, and it pushed them down a page). When you were logged out, you'd get a 500 error.

[Another bug I found was this](https://ruqqus.com/post/gei/cant-see-profiles-of-users-whose). (I love underscore-only usernames. Also note that the "not escaping underscores and % issue" hasn't been completely fixed yet. Eg. this https://ruqqus.com/signup?ref=sfr__ne would still say "@sfrohne has invited you!")

Edit: Seems like there are still timestamp issues. [That post](https://ruqqus.com/post/gg9/500-internal-server-error) says it was made 3 months ago but edited 4 months ago.

Here are some threads where some users say how they got it and some profiles where the badge is clickable:

* https://ruqqus.com/post/f29/how-did-you-get-the-breaker
* https://ruqqus.com/post/ach/how-does-one-acquire-the-breaker
* https://ruqqus.com/@Pseudologiste
* https://ruqqus.com/@vxern
* https://ruqqus.com/@ThePotatoOfDeath
body_html:
So they removed him from the ruqqus dev team, then immediately permabanned him from the entire site for "impersonation" because his bio said he was on the dev team (because he was until that second).

Ah, that sounds like some really sketchy behavior from the admins. The /help/admins page doesn't seem to list him. I'll check the discord later for more info.

Also how did you break ruqqus (that means finding bugs, right)? Yet another thing literally everyone but me has done (not that it's)!

Nah, not "everyone" has it. (Perhaps when you find a bug, ask the admins for it? I don't know lol. kek said this a few months ago on the discord: "Breaker of Ruqqus is earned when you find a bug that causes Ruqqus to crash", while someone else said that the admins sometimes award it for really trivial things. It seems that Seq37 is quite obsessed with trying to breaking ruqqus, so maybe you can ask him about it.)

I recently found out from this post that some badges are clickable. So my badge links to here: https://ruqqus.com/post/gg9/500-internal-server-error

I was really vague in my original post, but I found out that when you searched for posts, private ones were still visible, but only when you were logged in (I ended up voting on some of them, and it pushed them down a page). When you were logged out, you'd get a 500 error.

Another bug I found was this. (I love underscore-only usernames. Also note that the "not escaping underscores and % issue" hasn't been completely fixed yet. Eg. this https://ruqqus.com/signup?ref=sfr__ne would still say "@sfrohne has invited you!")

Edit: Seems like there are still timestamp issues. That post says it was made 3 months ago but edited 4 months ago.

Here are some threads where some users say how they got it and some profiles where the badge is clickable:

  • https://ruqqus.com/post/f29/how-did-you-get-the-breaker
  • https://ruqqus.com/post/ach/how-does-one-acquire-the-breaker
  • https://ruqqus.com/@Pseudologiste
  • https://ruqqus.com/@vxern
  • https://ruqqus.com/@ThePotatoOfDeath

body:
> Nah, not "everyone" has it.

Everyone who is even the least bit active has it. And everyone I know would get the imaginary "gold" version like 10x over.

So you see, I can't even accomplish the simplest things. I am the only user on the whole site without "Breaker of Ruqqus" because that's how much I suck at everything that I can't even find one bug. And I'm a fucking programmer. I'm also the only one who can't find things online, can't think outside the box, can't be creative, can't learn skills, can't do anything at all that requires any thinking whatsoever (same goes with anything "intuitive"). I wish people hadn't lied to me when I was a kid and told me I was super smart just because I got good grades for paying attention in class, because in reality I have to be the absolute biggest moron in history.

I'm not going to bother you any further unless you want me to. It's abundantly clear that this problem of mine can't ever be fixed and that I will never be good for anything. I should just quit everything, but my interests are too strong and always draw me back, only to torment me with this yet again. If I ever do accomplish anything, even the slightest thing, you can bet that it was by pure luck and not anything I actually did right, and I guarantee you I couldn't ever do it again. Maybe I should get a brain scan or something in a last ditch effort to find out what the fuck is wrong with me. If all else fails I'll have to just spend more time doing social activities so I'm not tempted to try my doing my own things again.
body_html:
Nah, not "everyone" has it.

Everyone who is even the least bit active has it. And everyone I know would get the imaginary "gold" version like 10x over.

So you see, I can't even accomplish the simplest things. I am the only user on the whole site without "Breaker of Ruqqus" because that's how much I suck at everything that I can't even find one bug. And I'm a fucking programmer. I'm also the only one who can't find things online, can't think outside the box, can't be creative, can't learn skills, can't do anything at all that requires any thinking whatsoever (same goes with anything "intuitive"). I wish people hadn't lied to me when I was a kid and told me I was super smart just because I got good grades for paying attention in class, because in reality I have to be the absolute biggest moron in history.

I'm not going to bother you any further unless you want me to. It's abundantly clear that this problem of mine can't ever be fixed and that I will never be good for anything. I should just quit everything, but my interests are too strong and always draw me back, only to torment me with this yet again. If I ever do accomplish anything, even the slightest thing, you can bet that it was by pure luck and not anything I actually did right, and I guarantee you I couldn't ever do it again. Maybe I should get a brain scan or something in a last ditch effort to find out what the fuck is wrong with me. If all else fails I'll have to just spend more time doing social activities so I'm not tempted to try my doing my own things again.

parent.body:
>So they removed him from the ruqqus dev team, then immediately permabanned him from the entire site for "impersonation" because his bio said he was on the dev team (because he was until that second).

Ah, that sounds like some really sketchy behavior from the admins. The [/help/admins](https://ruqqus.com/help/admins) page doesn't seem to list him. I'll check the discord later for more info.

>Also how did you break ruqqus (that means finding bugs, right)? Yet another thing literally everyone but me has done (not that it's)!

Nah, not "everyone" has it. (Perhaps when you find a bug, ask the admins for it? I don't know lol. kek said this a few months ago on the discord: "Breaker of Ruqqus is earned when you find a bug that causes Ruqqus to crash", while someone else said that the admins sometimes award it for really trivial things. It seems that Seq37 is quite obsessed with trying to breaking ruqqus, so maybe you can ask him about it.)

[I recently found out from this post that some badges are clickable](https://ruqqus.com/post/3un4/10-badges-an-absolute-record). So my badge links to here: https://ruqqus.com/post/gg9/500-internal-server-error

I was really vague in my original post, but I found out that when you searched for posts, private ones were still visible, but only when you were logged in (I ended up voting on some of them, and it pushed them down a page). When you were logged out, you'd get a 500 error.

[Another bug I found was this](https://ruqqus.com/post/gei/cant-see-profiles-of-users-whose). (I love underscore-only usernames. Also note that the "not escaping underscores and % issue" hasn't been completely fixed yet. Eg. this https://ruqqus.com/signup?ref=sfr__ne would still say "@sfrohne has invited you!")

Edit: Seems like there are still timestamp issues. [That post](https://ruqqus.com/post/gg9/500-internal-server-error) says it was made 3 months ago but edited 4 months ago.

Here are some threads where some users say how they got it and some profiles where the badge is clickable:

* https://ruqqus.com/post/f29/how-did-you-get-the-breaker
* https://ruqqus.com/post/ach/how-does-one-acquire-the-breaker
* https://ruqqus.com/@Pseudologiste
* https://ruqqus.com/@vxern
* https://ruqqus.com/@ThePotatoOfDeath

Another bug I found was this. (I love underscore-only usernames. Also note that the "not escaping underscores and % issue" hasn't been completely fixed yet. Eg. this https://ruqqus.com/signup?ref=sfr__ne would still say "@sfrohne has invited you!")

body:
I'm sure you're not "the only user" without that badge. Some of the more active users I've seen (at least, active enough so I could recognize their names), SentientSquirrel77, TrumpVoter1, carpathianflorist, Spring, milkit, and Albatros, all don't have the badge. [I'm also pretty sure that you've found at least 1 bug before](https://github.com/ruqqus/ruqqus/issues?q=author%3Acrystalvulpine+). (I'm not exactly a programmer, so I'm not really sure "how" to find bugs, but I sometimes like to browse the repository to see if there's anything, and I like to see if the site allows me to do unconventional things like sieging banned guilds (which you can, to my knowledge) or uploading non-pictures as my profile picture (which you can't do) or my banner (which you can do).)

>I'm also the only one who can't find things online

Hm, it's been a while since others have given you some suggestions on another thread. Did those help?

>I'm not going to bother you any further unless you want me to.

I enjoy talking with you, and I don't think you're "bothering" me in any sense (I actually like it when you reply to me), but I truly don't know how to help you with your situation. For me, things like "thinking outside the box" and "being creative" can be challenging as well. I think that it sometimes relies on having past experience and trying to connect those different experiences together. 

I do wish that you wouldn't think of yourself this lowly, and I do wish you'd continue with your interests even if it's challenging though. If you think that it would be better for you to quit for a while, it's okay.

I do wish that you wouldn't think of yourself this lowly, and I do wish you'd continue with your interests even if it's challenging though. If you think that it would be better for you to quit for a while, it's okay.

body:
> I like to see if the site allows me to do unconventional things

So do I but I rarely discover anything.

> Hm, it's been a while since others have given you some suggestions on another thread. Did those help?

I know of more sources now, but as for actually finding stuff myself, nope.

> I do wish that you wouldn't think of yourself this lowly, and I do wish you'd continue with your interests even if it's challenging though.

It's just that *EVERYONE* but me is a "god" at at least something, usually more than one thing, just by being interested in it. But me, even if I spend forever trying to get better my ceiling is still very low, a lot of times even still below the *starting point* of other people. I can be "good" at something but never great like everyone else, usually only ever as good as others are with their side interests. This only bothers me because it means I can't ever really make or do anything.
body_html:
I like to see if the site allows me to do unconventional things

So do I but I rarely discover anything.

Hm, it's been a while since others have given you some suggestions on another thread. Did those help?

I know of more sources now, but as for actually finding stuff myself, nope.

I do wish that you wouldn't think of yourself this lowly, and I do wish you'd continue with your interests even if it's challenging though.

It's just that EVERYONE but me is a "god" at at least something, usually more than one thing, just by being interested in it. But me, even if I spend forever trying to get better my ceiling is still very low, a lot of times even still below the starting point of other people. I can be "good" at something but never great like everyone else, usually only ever as good as others are with their side interests. This only bothers me because it means I can't ever really make or do anything.
